channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Obama's 3 choices on Syria
item.description: Among the most enduring urban legends about high-level policy-making in the U.S. government is the proverbial memo with three options: 1. do nothing; 2. do everything; 3. find a middle ground and muddle through.

item.title: Why cyberattacks from Syria matter
item.description: James Lewis says the Syrian Electronic Army attacked The New York Times to protest Western portrayal of Bashar al-Assad's regime.

item.title: See this painful beauty pageant oops
item.description: "Seeing is believing" this latest beauty queen blunder. CNN's Jeanne Moos says to be prepared to squirm.

item.title: Tylenol users get a new warning
item.description: Bottles of Extra Strength Tylenol will soon have a new warning on their caps: "Contains acetaminophen. Always read the label."

item.title: Surgeons shrink Indian child's head
item.description: The pictures may be difficult to look at, but 18-month-old Roona Begum's story of survival is remarkable.

item.title: Girl, 6, dies in crash; brother, 8, driving
item.description: A 6-year-old girl in Phoenix is dead after her 8-year-old brother took her on a joyride that went horribly wrong, police said.

item.title: 31 most beautiful sights on Earth
item.description: Editor's note: A previous version of this article was published in July 2012. We've added a few items and updated the list. We'd love to hear about your own "incredible sights" in the comments too.

item.title: Soldier's shocking airport surprise
item.description: A soldier returning home from an overseas deployment has a big surprise in store for his girlfriend.

item.title: Twin baby pandas now fuzzy, cute
item.description: CNN's Alina Machado checks on the progress of the baby twin pandas born at the Atlanta Zoo in July.

item.title: Army dad surprises girl at dance
item.description: Sergeant Kelly Carrigan returned from Afghanistan and surprised his teenage daughter at her homecoming dance.

item.title: Zeta-Jones and Douglas separate
item.description: Catherine Zeta-Jones and Michael Douglas are taking a break from their marriage.

item.title: Analysts: Any choice holds risks
item.description: President Obama cites a "wide range of options" to deal with Syria, but they boil down to this: bad, worse, and horrible.

item.title: U.N. inspectors get out
item.description: U.N. inspectors have left Syria, and Obama's allies and critics are beseeching him to wait for the U.N. report.

item.title: After a strike, then what?
item.description: As the United States weighs possible military strikes on Syria in response to a suspected chemical weapons attack, it has to consider a critical question: then what?

item.title: Another chemical attack?
item.description: CNN's Arwa Damon explains very graphic new video showing an alleged chemical attack at a school in Syria.

item.title: Al Qaeda's potent force
item.description: Why has the Obama administration been so reluctant to intervene in Syria? There are a host of reasons -- American fatigue with war, President Barack Obama's disinclination to start another conflict in the Middle East, and the splintered, fractured opposition to Bashar al-Assad.

item.title: 460-mile megacanyon discovered
item.description: British and American scientists watching Greenland's massive ice sheet have found what appears to be a 460-mile "megacanyon" far beneath the frozen surface of the world's largest island.

item.title: Can teens, parents share Facebook?
item.description: Carly and her mom are friends on Facebook, but that doesn't mean they share everything.

item.title: Dragon Con's growing pains
item.description: Atlanta's Dragon Con has built a reputation as an annual destination for acceptance and appreciation of all things nerdy. Over 25 years the convention has grown from a crowd of 1,400 to an expected 55,000 people this year. Here's a history of its birth and growing pangs.

item.title: Summer movies 'bigger and dumber'
item.description: The summer movie season is over, and the results are mixed. Some tentpoles flopped, others did well. Who knows what the future holds?

item.title: Trouble in Lamar Odom's marriage?
item.description: NBA player Lamar Odom was arrested and charged with DUI after police say he failed sobriety tests.

item.title: We could all be from Mars
item.description: Jessica Yellin talks with Bill Nye about one scientist who says evidence suggests life began on Mars, not Earth.

item.title: The best cat video of all time is ...
item.description: Catfight at a fest honoring top Web cat videos. Jeanne Moos says Golden Kitty award didn't put a smile on winner's face.

item.title: Clerk mooned over refund dispute
item.description: A Detroit woman is accused of vandalizing a store and mooning a worker when she was refused a refund. WXYZ reports.

item.title: Fla. to exhume bodies at boys school
item.description: This weekend, Florida will begin digging into its tragic past as anthropologists start unearthing what they believe are the remains of dozens of children buried on the grounds of a former reform school.

item.title: 22 deaths unaccounted for
item.description: Forensic researchers prepare to begin exhumations of the bodies at a Florida boys school. CNN's Ed Lavandera reports.

item.title: Soccer players accused of sex assault
item.description: Three members of a suburban Boston junior varsity boys' soccer team were arrested Friday in connection with an alleged sexual assault at a sports camp, according to authorities.

item.title: Cops: Woman paid hitman with stamps
item.description: A Brooklyn woman is facing conspiracy and solicitation charges after allegedly offering an undercover police officer $60,000 worth of rare postage stamps to kill her husband, the New York Police Department says.

item.title: Nyad tries Cuba-Florida swim again
item.description: If Diana Nyad never realizes her dream of swimming the Florida straits, it won't be for lack of trying. The 64-year-old says she will begin her fifth and last bid to swim from Cuba to the United States early Saturday.

item.title: Pres. denies Mandela left hospital
item.description: The anti-apartheid icon became an international symbol of the movement to end the system of racial segregation.

item.title: 4 dead in China quake
item.description: A 5.9-magnitude earthquake killed at least four people Saturday morning in southwestern China, state media reported.

item.title: Fired air marshal will get new hearing
item.description: A federal air marshal fired in 2006 for leaking information about air marshal travel cuts has won a victory before a federal court.

item.title: State may appeal 30-day rape sentence
item.description: Prosecutors in Billings, Montana are looking for legal standing to fight a 30-day sentence handed down to a teacher who admitted to raping his 14-year-old student.

item.title: Flesh-eating bacteria infects woman
item.description: An elderly woman becomes infected with flesh-eating bacteria after handling raw crab. WVUE has the story.

item.title: Can music stave off dementia?
item.description: Does music playing stave off dementia? How many years do you need to play music before it benefits your brain? What about just listening to music?

item.title: The world's scariest bridges
item.description: The world's highest bridges don't scare two men who have traveled to some of the scariest on the planet. And sometimes, when nobody's looking, they climb them.

item.title: Let's not let Robin Thicke off the hook
item.description: I promised myself that I wouldn't do it. I wasn't going to jump in to the whole Miley Cyrus circus. No siree. The pond was full. The seats were all taken. Social media was in overdrive. And everyone's been far too distracted. I, for one, was not about to enter the twerkosphere.

item.title: Why did he spare Hannah Anderson?
item.description: There are still many unanswered questions in the Hannah Anderson kidnapping case. CNN's Drew Griffin investigates.

item.title: Our galaxy's black hole is a picky eater
item.description: Black holes in the centers of galaxies must spit out a lot in order to swallow a little, new research suggests.

item.title: Playful kitten takes on pit bull
item.description: A kitten and a pit bull are the best of friends.

item.title: 20 top Letterman moments
Gut-wrenching story behind this photo
item.description: Marine Jesse Cottle lost his legs in Afghanistan. Now a picture of his wife carrying him on her back has gone viral.

item.title: Is this cheer skirt too short for school?
item.description: A Florida school has banned cheerleader skirts after administrators said they were too revealing for the classroom.

item.title: Ellsberg: He's a hero
item.description: Daniel Ellsberg tells CNN's Don Lemon that NSA leaker Edward Snowden showed courage, has done an enormous service.

item.title: Downing of Flight 007
item.description: The idea that Soviet fighters would shoot down a passenger 747 seems unbelievable. Two-hundred sixty-nine innocent people died in the attack 30 years ago.

item.title: The Soviet attack that shocked the world
item.description: In 1983, the USSR shocked the world by shooting down a Korean Air Lines jet that had departed the U.S. for South Korea.

item.title: A 50-year stint
item.description: A 71-year-old veteran returns to his family after serving the U.S.

item.title: Powerball loot
item.description: At least 3 people have winning $448 million jackpot tickets.

item.title: President Obama talks terror with Jay Leno.
item.description: CNN's Michaela Pereira has a look at the top news stories that you need to know.

item.title: Closings not 'overreaction'
item.description: President Obama talks terror with Jay Leno.

item.title: Economic vision
item.description: President Obama will deliver another major speech on the economy.

item.title: No 'fake' friends
item.description: Chris Cuomo and Kate Bolduan speak about genuine friendship.

item.title: Who we are
item.description: Get to know "New Day" anchors Kate, Chris and Michaela.

item.title: Fishing buddies
item.description: "New Day" anchors Chris Cuomo, Kate Bolduan and Michaela Pereira bond over a fishing trip.

item.title: Meet Michaela
item.description: Michaela Pereira on her background, her parents, and helping L.A.'s kids.

item.title: Meet Chris
item.description: Chris Cuomo talks about his two families -- one at home, one on TV.

item.title: Japan fed up with 'whack-a-mole' approach
item.description: Attempts by the operator of Japan's stricken nuclear power plant to deal with alarming leaks of toxic water are like a game of "whack-a-mole," the country's industry minister said this week.

item.title: Nuclear crisis in Japan
item.description: Japan is set to issue the gravest warning since last year's Fukushima nuclear plant meltdown. Kyung Lah reports.

item.title: Photos: Industrial disasters through history
Syria
item.description: United Nations weapons inspectors departed Syria on Saturday carrying precious cargo -- evidence and witness accounts collected from the sites of chemical weapons attacks.

item.title: Mandela
item.description: Former South African President Nelson Mandela returned to his Johannesburg home after a long hospital stay, two sources close to him said Saturday.

item.title: Black hole
item.description: You might think of black holes as indiscriminate eaters, hungrily gobbling up everything in their vicinity.

item.title: Tylenol
item.description: Bottles of Extra Strength Tylenol will soon have a new warning on their caps: "Contains acetaminophen. Always read the label."

item.title: Megacanyon
item.description: British and American scientists watching Greenland's massive ice sheet have found what appears to be a 460-mile "megacanyon" far beneath the frozen surface of the world's largest island.

item.title: Diana Nyad
item.description: If Diana Nyad never realizes her dream of swimming the Florida straits, it won't be for lack of trying. The 64-year-old says she will begin her fifth and last bid to swim from Cuba to the United States early Saturday.

item.title: Dragon Con
item.description: It took John and Jean Mayes of Richmond, Virginia, less than two hours to realize that they were woefully unprepared for their first Dragon Con in 2006.

item.title: Summer movies
item.description: What did Leonard Maltin think of the 2013 summer movie season?

item.title: People we've lost
